page.title: 19RYECROFT
page.content: Ryecroft is a hamlet comprising approximately a dozen dwellings, all of which except two are{"listed {buildings". }Most are modernised or converted{farm houses}or{quarry {workers' cottages. } The name "Ryecroft" originated in the area once being cultivated for rye which was evidently processed and brewed for ale on behalf of the monks of{Drax Abbey}which once held farming rights in the area. There is no mains water supply in the hamlet which is supplied by {natural spring water.} There is some concern at present about the re-opening of a local quarry which, it is thought, may disturb the water- table and affect supply. Two large storage tanks can be seen on the moorside.
